title: Jefferies hires Credit Suisse real estate analyst
text:
Jefferies Australia's recruitment drive shows no sign of slowing down, as it steps up its foray into the local institutional equities market.

It is understood Credit Suisse real estate analyst Andrew Dodds is set to join Jefferies after four years at the Swiss bank.

Dodds is expected to work in Jefferies' REIT research team which is run by Sholto Maconochie, and report to head of equities Andrew Norman.

It follows a raft of high-profile appointments at the American investment bank, including last month's hire of Deutsche Bank's former head of sales trading David Summerfield.

Of course, the bulk of Jefferies' institutional equities team are CLSA alumni, after Jefferies executed a bold raid on CLSA's Sydney office in June.
description: Jefferies Australia's recruitment drive shows no sign of slowing down.
